summary: North Carolina lacks a single statewide council district aggregator. Council districts are maintained individually by municipalities. However, several county-level and regional sources provide multi-city coverage.

aggregatorsFound.name: NCDOT Municipal Boundaries
aggregatorsFound.description: Statewide municipal boundary polygons for all NC incorporated municipalities. Based on Powell Bill Program maps. Does NOT contain council district data, but useful as a base layer for municipality identification.
aggregatorsFound.bulkPotential: HIGH - Use as reference layer to identify all municipalities, then cross-reference with individual city portals

aggregatorsFound.name: Mecklenburg County Open Mapping
aggregatorsFound.description: Mecklenburg County GIS provides open data for the Charlotte metro area. Contains Charlotte council districts and potentially other incorporated municipalities.
aggregatorsFound.bulkPotential: MEDIUM - Charlotte has 7 districts. Other towns in county may have separate council data.

aggregatorsFound.name: Wake County Open Data
aggregatorsFound.description: Wake County open data portal covering Raleigh and surrounding municipalities. Contains Raleigh city council districts.
aggregatorsFound.bulkPotential: MEDIUM - Raleigh has 5 districts. Cary has 4 districts (separate portal). Other towns may have at-large councils.

aggregatorsFound.name: Guilford County GIS
aggregatorsFound.description: Guilford County GIS covers Greensboro and High Point area. Council districts available through city-specific services.
aggregatorsFound.bulkPotential: MEDIUM - Greensboro has 5 districts. High Point has wards. Smaller towns may be at-large.

aggregatorsFound.name: Forsyth County MapForsyth
aggregatorsFound.description: Forsyth County GIS covers Winston-Salem area. Winston-Salem has 8 wards.
aggregatorsFound.winstonSalemWards: Ward layer available through MapForsyth - search for Wards_WS
aggregatorsFound.bulkPotential: MEDIUM - Winston-Salem has 8 wards. County-city consolidated services.

aggregatorsFound.name: Durham County Open Data
aggregatorsFound.description: Durham County/City consolidated open data portal. Contains city council wards.
aggregatorsFound.bulkPotential: LOW - Single city, but Durham has 3 wards plus at-large seats.

aggregatorsFound.name: Fayetteville/Cumberland County
aggregatorsFound.description: City of Fayetteville open data and ArcGIS Hub with council districts.

aggregatorsFound.name: Greenville Open Data
aggregatorsFound.description: City of Greenville (Pitt County) open data portal with council districts.

aggregatorsFound.name: New Bern GIS
aggregatorsFound.description: City of New Bern open data with aldermanic ward boundaries.

aggregatorsFound.name: Asheville Open Data
aggregatorsFound.description: City of Asheville open data and ArcGIS server. Council districts not found in current Boundaries folder.
aggregatorsFound.notes: Asheville may use at-large council system. Boundaries folder contains city limits but no council districts.

aggregatorsFound.name: Wilmington/New Hanover County
aggregatorsFound.description: City of Wilmington ArcGIS Online portal and GIS server.
aggregatorsFound.notes: Gallery and zoning maps available. Council districts require further exploration.

aggregatorsFound.name: Cabarrus County Open Data
aggregatorsFound.description: Cabarrus County (Concord, Kannapolis area) open data portal.
aggregatorsFound.notes: Data portal available but specific council district layers not confirmed.

regionalCOGs.name: Triangle J Council of Governments (TJCOG)
regionalCOGs.gisCapability: GIS analysis and web applications for member governments
regionalCOGs.notes: TJCOG provides GIS services to local governments but does not appear to maintain a regional council districts aggregator. Data is maintained by individual municipalities.

regionalCOGs.name: Centralina Regional Council
regionalCOGs.notes: Centralina serves as a regional connector but does not aggregate municipal council district data. CRTPO (Charlotte Regional TPO) has transportation data but not political boundaries.

regionalCOGs.name: Piedmont Triad Regional Council (PTRC)
regionalCOGs.gisCapability: GIS analysis, map production, web-based GIS applications
regionalCOGs.notes: PTRC provides GIS services to 78 member communities but does not maintain aggregated council district data. Individual municipalities maintain their own data.

regionalCOGs.name: Land of Sky Regional Council
regionalCOGs.gisCapability: GIS & Technical Services for member governments
regionalCOGs.notes: Western NC regional council. GIS services available but no aggregated council data.

stateResources.name: NC OneMap
stateResources.description: Statewide geospatial data clearinghouse. 37 priority data themes. Does NOT include council district data.

stateResources.name: NC General Assembly Redistricting
stateResources.description: State legislative and congressional district data. Does NOT include municipal council districts.

stateResources.name: NC State Board of Elections
stateResources.description: Voting precinct and district maps. Data at VTD level, not municipal council level.
stateResources.notes: VTD geography has no inherent relationship with municipal boundaries.

stateResources.name: NCSU Libraries GIS Archive
stateResources.description: Directory of 43 NC cities with GIS data. Useful for identifying which cities have GIS portals.

estimatedTotalCities.notes: Most smaller municipalities use at-large council systems. Cities over 50,000 population typically have district-based councils.

recommendations.action: Use NCDOT Municipal Boundaries as master reference
recommendations.description: Query https://gis11.services.ncdot.gov/arcgis/rest/services/NCDOT_CityBdy_Poly/MapServer/0 to get complete list of all 552 NC municipalities with population data. Filter by CensusPopulation > 10000 to identify cities likely to have districted councils.

recommendations.action: Harvest major county open data portals
recommendations.description: The 5 largest counties (Mecklenburg, Wake, Guilford, Forsyth, Durham) contain the majority of NC's urban population and have well-maintained open data portals with council district layers.
Cross-reference the 43 cities in NCSU Libraries GIS archive with population data. Programmatically check each city's GIS portal for council district layers.

recommendations.action: Search ArcGIS Hub for remaining cities
recommendations.description: Many NC cities publish to ArcGIS Hub. Search for '[CityName] NC council districts' or '[CityName] NC wards' patterns.
recommendations.searchPattern: site:hub.arcgis.com OR site:opendata.arcgis.com "north carolina" (council OR ward) districts

recommendations.description: Most NC municipalities under 10,000 population use at-large council systems without geographic districts. These cities do not require district boundary harvesting.
recommendations.notes: Approximately 500+ of NC's 552 municipalities are small towns with at-large councils.

keyFindings: No statewide aggregator exists for municipal council districts in NC
Council districts are maintained at municipal level, not state or regional level
Regional COGs (TJCOG, Centralina, PTRC) provide GIS services but do not aggregate council data
County-level open data portals are the best source for multi-city coverage
NCDOT Municipal Boundaries is an excellent reference for identifying all municipalities
Approximately 10-15% of NC municipalities have districted council systems (larger cities)
Most small towns use at-large council systems with no district boundaries to harvest
